title: Minister of Foreign Affairs ends working visit to Ethiopia by a series of meetings
text: Minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad, Mr Ramtane Lamamra, ended Thursday his working visit to the Republic of Ethiopia, by a series of bilateral meetings with the leadership of the African Union Commission, the United Nations representation to the African Union, as well as the CEO of the Ethiopian airline.Within the African Union, in the absence of the Chairman of the Commission, Mr Lamamra met with the Vice-Chairperson Monique Nsanzabaganwa, who is acting as his deputy, to whom he reiterated Algeria's support to improve the efficiency of the functioning of the continental organization, while stressing the need to place these efforts in the respect of the goals and principles enshrined in the Constitution Act.On this occasion, the Minister of Foreign Affairs shared with his interlocutor Algeria's analyses and perspectives on the state of peace and security in Africa as well as on the expected role of the AU in this context.The minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad examined with African Union Commissioner for Political Affairs, Peace and Security (AU-PAPS), Mr Bankole Adeoye, the major conflicts and crises in Africa and the prospects for their settlement.He further reiterated Algeria's determination to support the continent's collective action aimed at silencing arms and enshrining the principle of "African solutions to Africa's problems."Mr Ramtane Lamamra examined also, in Addis Ababa, the bilateral partnership opportunities in the field of air transport with Chief Executive Officer of Ethiopian Airlines, Mr Tewolde Gebremariam, notably the opening of a direct line between Addis-Ababa and Algiers and the promotion of trading between Algeria and African countries.
